intro: Exocarpos strictus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved holly. It is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern United States, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, red berries. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is often found in moist, wooded areas. Its leaves are typically glossy and dark green, while its flowers are inconspicuous and greenish-white. The berries, which are edible when ripe, attract various birds and small mammals.
